humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions that out of 13 lymph nodes examined, 8 had metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N2 according to the AJCC staging system, as N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage from this report is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions that eight out of thirteen (8/13) lymph nodes have metastatic carcinoma and extracapsular extension. This indicates that the cancer has spread to 8 or more axillary lymph nodes, which is classified as N2 according to the TNM staging system for cancer. Extracapsular extension refers to the spread of cancerous cells through the capsule of a lymph node and into the surrounding tissue, which is also indicative of a more advanced cancer stage.
